comment: I'm a senior now I took this class my very first semester at KSU, I was devastated when she gave me my first F. I still randomly think about how unfairly and poorly I was graded. Mind you.... this was almost 4 years ago. She was the worst, please avoid her at all costs if she still teaches this subject. RUN FAR FAR AWAY
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Took this professor back in 2020, if this professor still teaches then do not take her, my experience with her was a nightmare, I still remember her even now.

She is the most unreasonable, politically irrational, and otherwise most deranged professor I have ever met. You are expected to write to her narrative or fail, how this is legal is unknown.

I received my first F ever taking this person for lecture. She tells you on the first day "majority of the people who take my class fail". She was rude, would say out of line things, and was a harsh grader. Do not take her for this course.
If you want free time, back away. This class is a full time job
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: First day of class she states "I do not like getting into politics". Yet every assignment you do will be on politics, and every single lecture will be about politics.

She gave us what she called "Wake up call grades", in which she gave us all zero's on our first assignment because we didn't see a video she posted on D2L. I had to jump through all kinds of hoops and degrade myself to get feedback or even help understanding her assignments. But to be fair, this was during a pandemic. Could be different in person.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Schnur has been the best professor I have ever taken. She was so nice and great with helping at any time. Easy class as long as youre willing to work for it. LOVE Schnur!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Had her for one day and dropped soon after. She refers to the class as "her show". While going over the syllabus she strongly expressed her political and atheist views, which were not relevant to the course.
Do not take her!!!!! She gives out so much work and it sucks. Do not take her!!!! Spending my break completing her 8 readings and essays. Please do not take her
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She can help you but if youre on your phone during class she wont give you her time. Respect her and she will respect you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She is an awesome professor. As long as you actually try, she does her best to help you. She assigns work long before its due date to give plenty of time to finish it. If you talk to her and explain, she may accept late work from you (but do try your best on it). Her lectures are interesting and entertaining. The work is a lot but it can be fun.

Probably one of my favorite literature proffesors I've ever had. Coming to class mandatory is a buzz kill but she has very interesting topics she discuss in class. A lot of assignments but can be easily be finished day before its due.  Essays are fairly easy and you get to choose your own topic, but be weary its going to be for multiple assignments
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's really nice and friendly, but unless you want to devote your life to English, don't take this professor. There were four essays, 14 online quizzes (easy), two other projects, and 20 journal assignments . Don't ever do much in class but she'll fail you after a couple of absences. There were 3 small textbooks and you use them each a little bit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She's alright.  The first few weeks go by easy.  You have 1 essay on your template and life is good.  Then November hits and your life goes downhill really quick.  Woke up one day and realized I had like 5 projects due in the next week.  And 3 of them were recently assigned.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She's a very nice, friendly teacher. As long as you try, she'll work with you. Like everyone said, she isn't very specific, but that just leaves you more room to do whatever you want! Throw an idea by her and she'll make it work for you somehow. I would recommend, and I wish she had other classes I could take.

Took the hybrid version. Essays were fair and over interesting topics. Class was very discussion based but no mandatory participation. Willing to work with students if deadlines are missed or if there are questions. Overall, she's an interesting teacher who made class time fun and catered to the needs of the students.

Everything that she assigns is on an 1000 pt scale and for most of it if you do it you get an A.  She's a decent grader and grades on substance rather than nitpicking grammar.  The classes don't really matter but if you miss more than 3 you fail the course.  The final project is an easy A completion grade.

She's a GREAT teacher! Very understanding when it comes to complications at home etc.!! She gives a lot of work and her tests are extremely difficult! And she is very picky on the things that she uses in the text book! I would recommend her to everybody!

Knows her material. Uses Vista alot. Alot of writing in her class. She's an English professor also, so she grades very harshly. Do the online quizzes, go to class. It's ALOT of work, but I think I'll get a B.

This class was worse than I ever could have imagined. All of my friends had fun, interesting KSU 1101 classes, and this one was full of pointless projects and papers - all due within a 2 week period. I was more stressed over this class than all of my other classes combined. She takes this class to the extreme. She ruined my Mondays and Wednesdays.
I think she takes this to the extreme

She gives lots of assignments and grades fairly harshly on essays. Try and submit them to her early and she will help you improve them. Also she responds to e-mails fairly quickly. Do the work and you'll be fine.

She is a very nice person - always willing to help!! Cannot describe her helpfulness~  Returns emails very fast.  She does give a lot of assignments, but they are not weighted heavily.  Her point scale is out of 1000, instead of 100.  Always come to class or u will loose major points!  Do everything asked, and it will be an easy A!!! Awesome Prof.!

While all of my friends had very "easy A" freshman seminar classes, I was spending more time studying for this class than ANY of my others.  Overall, she is a very nice lady, but she does have her favorites, and she assigns too much work and papers and reading for a class like this that won't even transfer, which is what I got stuck with!

I actually got an A on two papers and did all assignments and she still gave me a B. The only person that gave her a good grade probably was on her good list. I believe it doesn't matter how good you do in the class she will grade you however she wants to and that makes her a bad teacher.

I don't know if she did a 360 or what but I loved her. She was very helpful. She would help with anything I needed. Just make an appointment with her and she will help. I am not a strong writer at all and I got an A in the class. She grades the papers somewhat rough but there are enough other assignments to make up for the papers you do bad on.

AVOID her KSU class! I thought it was going to be a nice class to get an A in while I got adjusted to college. Wrong! I had to work harder in this class than in any of my other classes due to 4 projects being due within a week. My grades explain it all: ENGL 1101, MATH 1113, SCI 1101 - A, POLS 1101 - B, KSU 1101 - C. Crazy, no?

Pointless class, and definitely NOT an easy A like I thought it'd be. Some things are interesting, but there were just WAY too many projects/papers/WORK! (Imagine that... =P) And I agree with the person above, she definitely had her favorites.

Definitly had her favorites. Not very specific on what she's looking for in a paper. Requires a lot of assignments to be done online, and doesn't always inform students of activities going on online. Doesn't go by syllabus. From what I understand, most of the class made C's and lower.
